definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: They mince and prim and pout.
sentences.chinese: 她們矯揉造作，一本正經還撅着嘴。

sentences.english: "What is your fee, Koriba?" she asked, suddenly businesslike.
sentences.chinese: “這怎麼收費，柯利巴？”她突然一本正經的問道。

sentences.english: Even the ones who understand may nod sagely.
sentences.chinese: 即使對方知道這一點，也會一本正經地點頭同意。

sentences.english: He searched for a topic which would warm her office impersonality into friendliness.
sentences.chinese: 他想找一個話題，使她一本正經的態度變得友好一點。

sentences.english: No one is exempt from talking nonsense; the mistake is to do it solemnly .
sentences.chinese: 誰也難免會講些廢話，錯就錯在一本正經地講。

sentences.english: No one is exempt from talking nonsense; the mistake is to do it solemnly.
sentences.chinese: 誰也難免會講些廢話，錯就錯在一本正經的講。

sentences.english: In a pinstriped suit he instantly looked like a stuffed shirt.
sentences.chinese: 穿上一套細條紋西裝後，他馬上就顯得一本正經起來。

sentences.english: Two prim spinsters are sitting together quietly.
sentences.chinese: 兩個一本正經的老處女安靜地坐在一起。

sentences.english: Keep a Poker face in business situations.
sentences.chinese: 要保持一種辦現公事時一本正經的神態。

sentences.english: She is naughty, but sometimes she is humorlessness and make others cannot help smiling.
sentences.chinese: 她頑皮，有時卻一本正經，讓人忍俊不禁。

sentences.english: "You will excuse my landlord, " said the old lady with a dignified air.
sentences.chinese: “請別怪我這位房東”老太太一本正經地說。

sentences.english: Under their stagnant respectability are whirlpools of evil and erotic passion.
sentences.chinese: 在他們一本正經的體面外表下，滿肚子的邪惡和情慾。

sentences.english: They are too serious, too academic and not imaginative enough.
sentences.chinese: 他們太一本正經，太學究氣，想象力也不夠豐富。

sentences.english: The transition from libertine to prig was so complete.
sentences.chinese: 從自由不羈到一本正經，這樣的轉變實在是太徹底了。

sentences.english: There is a humourlessness to too much sheen.
sentences.chinese: 過於閃亮顯得太一本正經了。

definition: as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
